questions.question: Compare Flexbox and Grid layouts. When would you use one over the other?
questions.answer:
Flexbox and Grid have different use cases:
Flexbox:
- Best for one-dimensional layouts (row OR column)
- Great for distributing space among items
- Ideal for navigation bars and component alignment

Grid:
- Perfect for two-dimensional layouts (rows AND columns)
- Better for overall page layouts
- Excellent for complex grid-based designs

Use Flexbox for component-level layouts and Grid for page-level layouts.

questions.question: Explain CSS animations and their performance implications
questions.answer:
CSS animations allow smooth transitions and keyframe-based animations:
- Use transform and opacity for best performance
- These properties don't trigger layout/paint
- Hardware acceleration via transform3d or will-change
- RequestAnimationFrame for JS animations
- Avoid animating layout properties like width/height
